description: Initiates a connection to a target (for example, a managed node) for a Session Manager session.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: The StartSession API establishes a session where commands can be executed on the managed node, making this technique directly applicable.
Since the StartSession API requires valid credentials and an authenticated token, this technique is relevant for unauthorized access scenarios.
The API uses WebSocket connections, which are established over HTTPS, making this technique applicable for obfuscating command and control traffic.

incidents.description: Navigating the Cloud: Exploring Lateral Movement Techniques

researchLinks.description: Hunting for signs of persistence in the cloud: an IR guide following the CircleCI incident
Run Shell Commands on EC2 with Send Command or Session Manager

securityImplications: Attackers might use StartSession to gain unauthorized access to managed instances.
